private_information: I specialize in converting natural-language action descriptions into consistent STRIPS-like schemas.
I ensure predicate arities and argument orders are consistent across all actions.
domain_miner.goal: Produce a coherent and normalized action schema from the provided domain description without emitting PDDL.

private_information: I specialize in normalizing objects and grounding initial states and goals across multiple scenarios.
I ensure the instances are internally consistent with the domain schema and ready for planning.
instance_miner.goal: Prepare structured, normalized instances from the provided initial facts and goals without emitting PDDL.

private_information: I integrate the domain and instance analyses and emit the final PDDL domain and problem files.
I target the Fast Downward solver and ensure STRIPS compliance with consistent predicate arities.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one per scenario) targeting the Fast Downward solver.

paltry.notes: From description: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2.

sip.notes: From description: sip object_0 object_1 object_2.

clip.notes: From description: clip object_0 object_1 object_2.

wretched.notes: From description: wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3.

memory.notes: From description: memory object_0 object_1 object_2.

tightfisted.notes: From description: tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.

public_information: Action vocabulary: paltry(x0,x1,x2), sip(x0,x1,x2), clip(x0,x1,x2), wretched(x0,x1,x2,x3), memory(x0,x1,x2), tightfisted(x0,x1,x2).
Predicates and arities: cats/1, hand/1, sneeze/1, spring/1, stupendous/1, texture/1, collect/2, vase/2, next/2.
Semantics: paltry requires hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, vase x0 x1, next x1 x2; adds next x0 x2; deletes vase x0 x1.
Semantics: sip requires hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, next x0 x2, next x1 x2; adds vase x0 x1; deletes next x0 x2.
Semantics: clip requires hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, next x0 x2; adds vase x0 x1; deletes next x0 x2.
Semantics: wretched requires sneeze x0, texture x1, texture x2, stupendous x3, next x0 x1, collect x1 x3, collect x2 x3; adds next x0 x2; deletes next x0 x1.
Semantics: memory requires cats x0, spring x1, spring x2, next x0 x1; adds next x0 x2; deletes next x0 x1.
Semantics: tightfisted requires hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, vase x0 x1; adds next x0 x2; deletes vase x0 x1.
Scenario S1 goal: next object_12 object_11.
Scenario S2 goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5.

extract.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst; convert the provided environment.init.actions and environment.init.predicates into a consistent STRIPS-like action schema without emitting PDDL, and return a concise JSON object with fields actions, predicates, types (optional), and any normalization notes.
extract.prompt: Your name is domain_miner. Use the domain information in {environment->init->predicates} and {environment->init->actions} and the narrative in {environment->public_information} to produce a coherent, normalized action schema as a compact JSON object, preserving names and arities exactly, aligning parameter orders consistently, and noting any assumptions; do not output PDDL.

ground.system_prompt: You are an instance analyst; normalize objects and prepare grounded instances for planning without emitting PDDL, returning a concise JSON object with fields objects, constants (if any), invariants (optional), and a list of instances each with id, init_facts, and goal_facts.
ground.prompt: Your name is instance_miner. Use the scenarios in {environment->instances}, the predicates in {environment->init->predicates}, and the available objects in {environment->init->objects} to produce a compact JSON summary of the planning instances with normalized facts and goals; do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-instance PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver; produce one valid PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one per scenario) using STRIPS-style constructs and consistent predicate arities; always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and each PDDL problem between separate <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the domain schema from {action_schemas} and the instances from {instances_summary} to build a single consistent PDDL domain and two problems named s1 and s2 for Fast Downward; ensure actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted have preconditions and effects exactly as specified; ensure predicates cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, vase, and next have correct arities; include all required objects; if an S1 reference plan exists in {environment->instances}, do not include it in the output but ensure the model could accommodate it; output only one <domain> block followed by two <problem> blocks.
